ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient presents with amyloidosis of peripheral nerves, which is a hallmark of familial amyloid polyneuropathy. Chronic diarrhea and constipation can also occur due to autonomic neuropathy in this condition.
AL amyloidosis can involve peripheral nerves and the gastrointestinal tract, leading to amyloidosis of peripheral nerves and chronic diarrhea/constipation.
This rare form of amyloidosis can present with peripheral neuropathy and gastrointestinal symptoms, though it is less common than transthyretin or AL amyloidosis.
A rare form of amyloidosis that can involve peripheral nerves and the gastrointestinal tract, though it is less commonly associated with these symptoms compared to other forms.
Fabry disease can present with peripheral neuropathy and gastrointestinal symptoms like diarrhea and constipation, though it is not primarily an amyloidosis disorder.
